comments:
Hi
  I had wsad5.0 previuosly.Recently I have downloaded eclipse 2.1.2 and copied 
the files into WSAD installed directory.After that my workspace is not coming 
up, I tried giving the JRE -VM argument as well. I have captured this error 
message from .log file. Kindly give me a solution to this.
thanks in advance.
-Satya
Error message
SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 Nov 21, 2003 11:31:22.987
!MESSAGE Unknown extension point "org.eclipse.ui.commands" specified in plug-
in "org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor".
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Nov 21, 2003 11:31:23.87
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Widget
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:262)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.createExecutableExtension
(PluginDescriptor.java:136)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.createExecutableExtension
(PluginDescriptor.java:165)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension
(ConfigurationElement.java:102)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderGetRunnable
(InternalPlatform.java:461)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.getRunnable
(InternalBootLoader.java:457)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:827)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)

This is not the way to install Eclipse - by justing copying over your existing 
plugins in a different application you will have left over resources and as a 
reuslt likely references to code that does not exist or cannot be reused.

I suspect you won't be able to do this easily as you need a version of WSAD 
build on the 2.1 codebase in order for it to work with 2.1.
